Quiet and discreet place, little frequented except for summer weekends during the day.

title: (28750) San Agustín del Guadalix -
description: Great place, nice view, very peaceful. In the morning for walkers and mountain bikers. Difficult access by small paths (it goes by L2H2 van) Pretty waterfall (cascada del hervidero) above the village of San Augustin del Guadalix.

title: (28413) El Boalo - 2 Avenida de la Paz

In a large park where there are sports fields, a fountain, etc. Area with very nice views and lots of shade. Wooded and sheltered. At City Hall, they told us it was ok if they are not long stays. The first week of July, apparently, there is a feria. Maybe there are more difficulties. We had two nights without problems, there was only one other van. Great for walking in the Sierra.

There is no lighting.

The site is perfect for trekking and mountain biking, it is very beautiful. The city has a lot of life

The sun rises behind the institute and there is morning shadow.

title_short: (28792) Miraflores de la Sierra - 63D Avenida de Madrid

title: (28492) Mataelpino - 14 Calle del Pocillo
description: Dirt parking on the outskirts of town, next to the Camino de Santiago. Dirt parking in the upper part of the town, at the exit towards La Maliciosa and La Barranca. The Camino de Santiago and a cattle route pass by, a little further on there is a cattle resting place with a large trough where dogs can cool off very comfortably. Very quiet and discreet place to spend the night although it is within the town. Nearby there are shops and the town square, where there is a fountain and bathrooms. There is also a hostel for pilgrims. From that point there are two super nice roads, one to the west along the livestock route and the other to the east through the Sierra de los Porrones, with spectacular views). At the foot of Maliciosa, in the Sierra de Guadarrama National Park. There are many routes, PR, GR, Camino de Santiago... La Pedriza, La Barranca and Puerto de Navacerrada are also nearby.

title: (28492) El Boalo - 72P Avenida de los Linares
title_short: (28492) El Boalo - 72P Avenida de los Linares
description: Wooded parking in the center of the village. It is a quiet place to stay overnight, even if it is in the city. There is a large parking lot, in the upper part it is more hidden from view and there is a lot of shade. It is in the center but it is discreet and very calm. Opposite there are shops and next to it is the town square, where there is a fountain and wc. At the foot of the Maliciosa, in the Sierra de Guadarrama National Park. There are many trails, PR, GR, Camino de Santiago ... it is also near La Pedriza, La Barranca and Puerto de Navacerrada.

title: (28702) San Sebastián de los Reyes - 12 Calle de Alonso Zamora Vicente
title_short: (28702) San Sebastián de los Reyes - 12 Calle de Alonso Zamora Vicente
description: Parking between houses with plenty of space, can be used to visit micropolix and there is a shopping center nearby, as well as supermarkets. there are more ACs than people who live in the area.

title: (28794) -
description: Beautiful place to spend the night without being disturbed by almost anything because you cannot bathe but if it is for fishing, hiking and MTB ... there are no shadows (a shame) ... we have been one night and great ... .But in the afternoon the guard passed by and did not tell us anything .... if you run out of water you have outside the yacht club (left side) a fountain along the walkway that is on the hiking route (bring a lot of water and cream that in summer you roast or heat handles ... be careful when entering the road has many potholes, go slowly ...... enjoy it but respect it and take care of it .. Thank you

title_short: (28703) San Sebastián de los Reyes - 112 Calle Real

title: (28723) Pedrezuela - 1 Diseminado Arroyo Prados
description: Good place to spend the day and night. A few meters ahead there is a no-trespassing sign. We enter through C. Àvila. The entire reservoir is surrounded by a fence, since bathing is prohibited. It is a fishing ground and many fishermen jump that fence to spend the day with the rod on the shore. In the morning many cyclists and people walking. There are containers, please make use of them, we saw a lot of garbage on the walk we did .. a shame. From the E-5, send a chunk along a road with many potholes, take the detour and pass by the restaurant "Los nueva hornos de Ángel".

title: (28400) Collado Villalba - 82 Calle Mallorca
description: Quite flat quiet parking located between urbanizations.

title: (28232) Las Rozas - Unnamed Road

Near by: supermarket,restaurants and bars, athletic stadium and swimming pool, indoor skydiving simulator and very nice park for walks or bycicle rides. Water pumps with drinkable water placed on the side of the park. Also 300 m far is Repsol gas station. If you need WIFI there is street full of little restaurants with accesible connection.

title: (28050) Madrid - 13 Camino Arroyo de Valdebebas
description: Quiet place to sleep, sure. Next to the nursery. Wide campas to walk and from here to visit the city. At night no noise

title: (28034) Madrid - 10 Calle Condestables
description:
A free and fairly quiet car park both during the day and at night.

A 10 minute walk from a metro stop. And by bike 10 minutes from the Castellana.

Highly recommended for old or unlabeled campers, since they cannot enter the m30 and interior of Madrid, due to the environment.

There are no parking lots so close and free around the city.

The only drawback is that it has quite a few holes in the ground, be careful with the bass, although going slow is no problem.

title: (28034) Madrid - 24 Calle Sangenjo
description: Laundry. It has washers of up to 15 / 18Kg and dryers. Banknote exchange machine for coins.

name: Camping El Valle

description: Camping El Valle. Quiet, family friendly, with lots of flowers and trees for shady pitches. It looks old but be careful. Especially with fixed people with Mobil home but also plots with / without electricity and bungalows. It has a summer pool. Views of the mountains, beautiful area

title: (28491) Navacerrada - 3 Pasaje de las Eras
description: Small parking on the other side of the park. a little more flat and quiet for my taste, there is less passage of people and on Sundays there are fewer people, because in the parking lot below many people leave the car to take the vermouth from the El Porron bar and sometimes they block the access road , do not miss visiting it, playground next door. It is a parkimg not a campsite. prohibited to take out goods abroad. Vehicles over 7m50 pass carefully

title: (28046) Madrid - 2A Calle Tulipan
description: Free gravel parking used by locals. It's a little hard to find the right entry. It seems unregulated but everybody uses it and you won't get a ticket. The entry roads are VERY bumpy with lots of potholes, it gets better inside the parking and it's worth it, you won't find a free parking as well situated in Madrid. It's very close to one of the main train stations (CHAMARTIN) and bus stations (PLAZA DE CASTILLA) and there are bars and supermarkets all around. It's also unusually silent for it's location appart from the rush hours where people parks in our out to go to work/home. I asked around and everybody said that it was a very safe place to park as well.

title: (28491) Navacerrada - 9A Calle Presbítero Blanco
description:
Free public parking just behind the local police office. To enter this place you must have access between the police building and El Porrón Restaurant.
At the corner of the entrance you can see a yellow sign indicating the direction to this public parking.
It is a place protected from the wind and very quiet since it is located between urbanized areas and although it is very close to the center, no noise or traffic is heard.
It has a large park but the nearest fountain is in Plaza del Gargantón a few meters away and from which you can catch water but not load tanks with hose.
At the moment it is of beaten earth and it is a very calm place.
Prohibited to remove tables, chairs or any other camping element. Please respect the environment and use the bins.

title: (28055) Madrid - Avenida de Francisco Javier Sáenz de Oiza
title_short: (28055) Madrid - Avenida de Francisco Javier Sáenz de Oiza
description: Parking of Valdebebas Park. Without services, surveillance or toilets. 150 m from a Burguer King and a bus stop to Plaza de Castilla. Quiet place and little crowded.

title: (28220) Majadahonda - 2 Calle Granja del Conde
description: Giant parking parallel to the road. Right now it's Sunday at 22:53 and there are cars passing by. The good part is that it is next to the headquarters of the local police and in front of a grocery store that is still open.

title: (28200) San Lorenzo de El Escorial - 13 Calle 6 Sau
title_short: (28200) San Lorenzo de El Escorial - 13 Calle 6 Sau

description: Great laundry. The owner, Roberto, available on the mobile for any questions or concerns. Very nice. He is also president of the Tetuán triathlon club. All your information on map.

title: (28220) Majadahonda - 9 Calle la Traviata
description: Quiet and well located location. There is a Mc Donalds nearby and also a supermarket. We spent the night and during the day we went by bus to the center of Madrid

title: (28741) Rascafría - Calle Angostura

title: (28055) Madrid - Av. de las Fuerzas Armadas
title_short: (28055) Madrid - Av. de las Fuerzas Armadas
description: Parking very close to Ifema, perfect for the Mad Cool Festival (5 to 10 min walk from the entrance). A few trees create shade, and a large public park is a 2-minute walk away with very clean toilets open during the day (go to the second brown hut, the 1st is a technical room). There is something to walk around and games for children. Tap with drinking water. Despite the festival, we were only a few Vans and CCs on this huge parking lot, so all very well-off and spaced out. For light sleepers, bring earplugs for the return walk of festival-goers, but the road is closed to traffic so perfect for the night.

title: (28220) Majadahonda - 4D Camino Mina
description: Quiet vacant lot in a residential neighborhood on the outskirts of Madrid. The population here is high income so there is a lot of tranquility. We have spent one night. Good views of Madrid and a lot of silence.

description: Parking in a nice area with a lot of well-kept green. ideal for a quiet night out.
